alert.note: Alert for Craig; Creek; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued July 22 at 1:45PM CDT until July 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT SATURDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 107 this afternoon and Saturday. 106. Dangerously hot conditions Sunday with actual temperatures near 105 and heat indices up to 107 possible. * WHERE...Osage, Washington OK, Nowata, Craig, Ottawa, Pawnee, Tulsa, Rogers and Creek Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM CDT this evening and from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Saturday and Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may combine to create a dangerous situation in which heat illnesses are possible.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work the occupational safety and health administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 911.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Creek; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
